actor_awards.notes: Nominated for Best Actor in a Leading Role for 'Murphy's Romance' (1985). Received the Screen Actors Guild Life Achievement Award in 2005.

filmography.title: The Great Escape
filmography.role_description: A resourceful American POW who can procure just about anything needed for the escape effort.
filmography.plot: Allied prisoners of war plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.

filmography.title: The Americanization of Emily
filmography.role_description: A cynical American naval officer who is a self-proclaimed coward but is chosen to be the first man on Omaha Beach.
filmography.plot: An American naval officer talented at living the good life during wartime falls for a British widow and is sent on a dangerous mission.

filmography.title: Murphy's Romance
filmography.role_description: A widowed small-town pharmacist who falls for a divorced mother, earning Garner his only Academy Award nomination.
filmography.plot: A divorced mother moves to a small town and finds romance with an older, eccentric pharmacist.

filmography.title: Victor/Victoria
filmography.role_description: A Chicago mobster and nightclub owner who finds himself attracted to a female impersonator who is actually a woman.
filmography.plot: A struggling female soprano finds work playing a male female impersonator, but it complicates her personal life when a gangster falls for her.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor in a Motion Picture - Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: Support Your Local Sheriff!
filmography.role_description: A laid-back, sharpshooting stranger who becomes the sheriff of a lawless gold rush town.
filmography.plot: In the Old West, a man passing through a gold rush town on his way to Australia takes the job of sheriff to earn some money.

filmography.title: Grand Prix
filmography.role_description: An American Formula One driver attempting a comeback after being fired for causing a crash.
filmography.plot: American Grand Prix driver Pete Aron is fired by his Jordan-BRM racing team after a crash at Monaco that injures his British teammate, Scott Stoddard.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Sound, Best Film Editing

filmography.title: The Notebook
filmography.role_description: The older version of Noah Calhoun, who reads their love story to his wife suffering from dementia.
filmography.plot: A poor yet passionate young man falls in love with a rich young woman, giving her a sense of freedom, but they are soon separated because of their social differences.
filmography.awards: Screen Actors Guild: Nomination – Outstanding Performance by a Cast

filmography.title: Space Cowboys
filmography.role_description: A retired Air Force pilot and engineer recruited back into service to stop a crashing Russian satellite.
filmography.plot: When a retired engineer is called upon to rescue a failing satellite, he insists that his equally old teammates accompany him into space.

filmography.title: Maverick
filmography.role_description: A lawman who is revealed to have a surprising connection to the title character, played by Mel Gibson.
filmography.plot: Bret Maverick, needing money for a poker tournament, faces various comic mishaps and challenges, including a charming woman thief.

filmography.title: Sayonara
filmography.role_description: A Marine Corps captain stationed in Japan who is a friend to Marlon Brando's character.
filmography.plot: A US Air Force Major in Kobe, Japan falls in love with a Japanese dancer, despite the military's opposition to interracial marriages.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor (Red Buttons)

filmography.title: 36 Hours
filmography.role_description: An American intelligence officer kidnapped by Nazis who try to trick him into believing the war is over.
filmography.plot: Germans kidnap an American major and try to convince him that World War II is over, so that he will reveal Allied invasion plans.

filmography.title: Support Your Local Gunfighter
filmography.role_description: A con artist who is mistaken for a famous gunfighter and decides to play along for profit.
filmography.plot: A gigolo con man arrives in a mining town controlled by two competing companies, who both try to hire him to drive the other out of town.

filmography.title: Hour of the Gun
filmography.role_description: A grim and historically accurate portrayal of Wyatt Earp seeking vengeance after the O.K. Corral.
filmography.plot: Marshal Wyatt Earp kills a couple of men of the Clanton gang in a fight. In revenge, Clanton's thugs kill the marshal's brother.

filmography.title: The Children's Hour
filmography.role_description: The fiancé of Karen Wright, who stands by her when she is accused of having a lesbian relationship.
filmography.plot: A rebellious student at a girls' school accuses two teachers of being lesbians.

filmography.title: Skin Game
filmography.role_description: A con man who teams up with a free-born black man to scam slave owners in the pre-Civil War South.
filmography.plot: A white con man and a black man pose as a slave owner and his slave to bilk money from unsuspecting buyers.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: Marlowe
filmography.role_description: Raymond Chandler's famous private detective, updated to the late 1960s setting.
filmography.plot: Private eye Philip Marlowe tries to locate the missing brother of a woman who claims she has no family.

filmography.title: The Thrill of It All
filmography.role_description: An obstetrician whose life is turned upside down when his wife becomes a celebrity spokesperson.
filmography.plot: A housewife's sudden rise to fame as a soap spokesperson causes chaos in her obstetrician husband's life.

filmography.title: Move Over, Darling
filmography.role_description: A man who remarries after his first wife is declared dead, only for her to return on his honeymoon.
filmography.plot: After having been lost at sea for several years, a missing wife thought long dead returns just after her husband has remarried.

filmography.title: Darby's Rangers
filmography.role_description: The commander who organizes and leads the first units of United States Army Rangers during WWII.
filmography.plot: The story of the formation and training of the elite 1st Ranger Battalion during World War II.

filmography.title: Cash McCall
filmography.role_description: A wealthy business adventurer who buys and sells companies, finding romance in the process.
filmography.plot: A man who buys companies to sell them at a profit falls in love with the daughter of the owner of a failing plastics company.

filmography.title: Duel at Diablo
filmography.role_description: A frontier scout seeking revenge for his wife's murder while guiding a cavalry supply column.
filmography.plot: A scout seeks the killer of his Comanche wife while guiding a supply train through Apache territory.

filmography.title: Sunset
filmography.role_description: An aging Wyatt Earp serving as a technical advisor in 1920s Hollywood.
filmography.plot: Wyatt Earp and Tom Mix team up to solve a murder in 1929 Hollywood.

filmography.title: Tank
filmography.role_description: A career soldier who uses his own tank to rescue his son from a corrupt sheriff.
filmography.plot: A sergeant major takes his own Sherman tank on a rampage to bust his son out of a corrupt town's jail.

filmography.title: My Fellow Americans
filmography.role_description: A Democratic ex-president who teams up with his Republican rival to expose a conspiracy.
filmography.plot: Two feuding ex-presidents join forces to clear their names when the current administration tries to frame them.

filmography.title: Twilight
filmography.role_description: A retired movie star and friend to Paul Newman's detective character in this neo-noir thriller.
filmography.plot: A retired detective living with a dying actor and his wife gets drawn into a murder mystery from the past.

filmography.title: Barbarians at the Gate
filmography.role_description: The CEO of RJR Nabisco who attempts a massive leveraged buyout. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: The president of a major tobacco company attempts to buy out the company himself, triggering a bidding war.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor in a Miniseries or TV Movie; Primetime Emmy: Win – Outstanding Made for Television Movie

filmography.title: The Castaway Cowboy
filmography.role_description: A Texas cowboy who gets shanghaied and ends up in Hawaii, teaching locals how to ranch.
filmography.plot: A Texas cowboy is rescued at sea and ends up in Hawaii, where he helps a widow and her son start a cattle ranch.

filmography.title: One Little Indian
filmography.role_description: A cavalry deserter who travels across the desert on a camel with a young boy.
filmography.plot: A cavalry soldier on the run meets a boy raised by Indians and together they try to evade capture while riding a camel.

filmography.title: Up Periscope
filmography.role_description: A Navy Frogman assigned to a submarine for a dangerous mission to photograph Japanese codes.
filmography.plot: A U.S. Navy Frogman is smuggled into a Japanese-held island via submarine to photograph a code book.
